Tony Blair 's former spin doctor Alastair Campbell said there was a ''greater stench'' to the scandal. He said: First, there's the issue of David Cameron and George Osborne 's judgment, then there's the News of the World and what appears to be industrial phone hacking going on systematically. ''There's also the issue of the News Corp takeover of BSkyB and the apparent attempts by Jeremy Hunt, the Culture Secretary, to let that go through without proper scrutiny, and finally there's the extraordinary conduct of the police. Donald Rumsfeld : Maybe We Needed More Troops by Staff President Bush U.S. Defense Donald Rumsfeld is conceding ''it's possible'' too few troops were sent to invade Iraq. In a war, many things cost lives, Donald Rumsfeld told ABC in an interview to be broadcast on ''Nightline'' Monday. President Bush has written that the troop level in Iraq was ''the most important failure in the execution of the war.''

As for the show's title star, Robert Christopher Riley says Dan Lauria remained calm throughout the game, but did briefly channel Vince Lombardi 's signature hothead behavior when he yelled at the TV after questionable plays. I think the American people have got to start demanding more of our public officials and of the media, Colin Powell said. Colin Powell was secretary of state to Republican President Bush during the run-up to the Iraq War and the first years of the conflict and considered running for president as a Republican candidate in 1996.

, the resignation posed the biggest trouble for the News of the World's owners. Murdoch's News Corporation is currently trying to persuade regulators to let it take over pay television giant BSkyB.
